result.execSummary:
The defendant Pierre Cardell Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $7,946.00 to Charles A., $5,000.00 to Christina M. and $4,000.00 to Crime Victim Compensation or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Citizen victims to be paid first, alternating payments during Extended Supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
AS TO RESTITUTION/COSTS/FEES/SURCHARGES:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with the victims families without prior Court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
No contact with the coactors without prior Court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
No firearms, weapons.

Cognitive intervention programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Attend Crime Victim Impact panel.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Per Order dated September 13, 2022, Appeal No 2021AP560-CR,
IT IS ORDERED that the motion to seal is granted. The Clerk of the Supreme Court shall place the petition for review and appendix filed in this matter on May 20, 2022, as well as the statement in support of the petition for review filed on July 1, 2022 under seal. Wis. Stat. (Rule) 809.86(5)("the court may make any order necessary to protect the identity of a victim or other person, or to excuse compliance with this section....").
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs. 
PATIENCE DRAKE ROGGENSACK, J., did not participate.

Per Remittitur dated September 14, 2022, Appeal No 2021AP000560-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed on April 26, 2022, that:
Judgment and order affirmed
Acknowledgement of Statement in Support of the Petition for Review has been filed with the Wisconsin Supreme Court - Appeal No 2021AP000560-CR

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for filing the appellant's brief and appendix is extended until July 12, 2021.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Christina M., Charles A. and Artravia M.

COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 YEARS, with credit for 380 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 17 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 2 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 17 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Attend Crime Victim Impact panel.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim's families without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* No contact with the co-actors without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Restitution payable to Charles A. for $7,946.00, Christina M. for $5,000.00, and Crime Victim Compensation for $4,000.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Citizen victims to be paid first, alternating payments during extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

 Filed,

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Amended information, received and filed, amending COUNT 1 & 2 to 2nd DEGREE RECKLESS HOMICIDE - AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.06(1), a Class D.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

COUNT 1 & 2 (AMENDED)
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements of the Offense/Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered without a recommendation.

COUNT 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, count 3 is dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.

Court vacates the BODY ATTACHMENT for Mildred Boyd and Kortez Hogan.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Pierre Cardell Brown not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Due to the lateness of the hour case not called on the record.  Branch 06 in trial (unrelated case) and unable to hear this matter on today.  Case adjourned to 12-16-15 at 8:30 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 06.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris as STAND-BY counsel.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court is currently in trial.  Case was spun to br. 7 for trial.   Substitution was submitted.  Court finds the defendant waived right to SPEEDY.  Court is willing to try the case if will be completed in 4 days.  Defendant wishes for STAND-BY counsel to be appointed as counsel.  Defense counsel is ready to proceed, however, if granted an adjournment he feels he would be more prepared.  Court ordered case adjourned for trial  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

BRANCH 7 (MCADAMS)  FOR  BRANCH 6 (BROSTROM)
Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge McAdams.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Stipulation received and filed with court.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris as STAND-BY counsel.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Case remain in trial posture.  Crime Lab reports submitted to defense regarding the bullet.  Defense stipulate to previous felony conviction.  Stipulation to be submitted to the court date of trial.  Defense plan to submit evidence to use in questioning of State's witness is found not admissable by the courts.  State has very recently submitted an offer to defense.  Defense has recently received additional discovery and raises issues with the court.  Plea negotiations remain open.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with standby counsel Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Court received numerous filings from both parties yesterday, 11/30/15.  Case passed so Court can review filings.

Case recalled at 9:15 am.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denied defendant's Motion to Dismiss - Inadequate Preliminary Hearing, as this motion is barred.  Discussion regarding party to a crime modifier.  Court denied defendant's Motion to Dismiss with regard to organ donation.  Court denied defendant's Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informant.  Court addressed both parties' Motions in Limine.  Court ordered defendant has two relevant convictions for the purposes of impeachment.  State is in the process of serving its witnesses.  State will check for convictions of its witnesses.  Defense plans to question only state's witnesses.  Parties inform Court that trial should last 4-5 days.  Defendant did make a statement but state will likely not use it at trial.  Parties report there will be no other acts or character evidence introduced.  State informs Court that there will be expert testimony.  Defense reports that defendant's family will provide clothes for defendant.  Parties state that resolution is possible and Court ordered negotiations remain open.  Discussion regarding ballistics evidence.  Discussion regarding videos submitted to defense.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial conference in Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informant on behalf of defense received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris as standby counsel.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
State will furnish attorney Harris with discovery.  Motions will be addressed at the next court appearance as standby counsel has not had time to review motions.  Court ordered state's response to any defense motions due 11/30/15.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial conference on 12/1/15 at 8:30 am and jury trial on 12/14/15 at 10:00 am in Branch 6.

Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Pierre Cardell Brown in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for motion hearing.

Court ordered attorney Harris is to be paid by the County of Milwaukee at a rate of $60.00/hour.  Court waives repayment by defendant.
